## Shen Lab@Mount Sinai
Our lab is located on the Mount Sinai campus in the New York City. We are on the Madison Avenue that is only one block away from the central park. Our lab is about bioinformatics and currently there are two focuses:

1. Large-scale next-generation sequencing (NGS) analysis
2. Novel software development for NGS analytics

## Members
I'm actively looking for a postdoc in bioinformatics with emphasis on NGS analysis and software. Interested? Send your CV to li.shen@mssm.edu.

Li Shen, Principal Investigator, @shenlab-sinai, @lishen

Ningyi Shao, postdoc, @ny-shao

Immanuel Purushothaman, bioinformatician, @ipurusho

### Past Members
Ying Jin, postdoc ==> scientist@Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory

Xiaochuan Liu, postdoc ==> postdoc@Rutgers University

## Software Projects
These are the software we are currently working on:
* ngs.plot: Quick Mining and Visualization of Next-Generation Sequencing Data by Integrating Genomic Databases. [ngs.plot on Google code](https://code.google.com/p/ngsplot/)
* diffReps: Automated ChIP-seq Differential Analysis. [diffReps on Google code](https://code.google.com/p/diffreps/)
* GeneOverlap: R Package for Testing and Visualizing Gene Overlaps. [GeneOverlap on Github](https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/geneoverlap)

We have participated in:

STAR genome browser: An Integrated Solution to Management and Visualization of Sequencing Data. [STAR website](http://wanglab.ucsd.edu/star/browser)
